intro: Euphrasia alpina var. media, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Euphrasia alpina var. media is often found in mountainous areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
